trust-ai.title: TrustAI Shield: AI Fraud & Deepfake Detection
trust-ai.subtitle: TrustAI Shield is an intelligent digital guardian designed to help users browse the web with confidence by detecting online scams, fake profiles, and deepfakes.

about.title: About the Project: Purpose
about.description: The project aims to build an intelligent digital “guardian” that helps users browse the Web with confidence. Its objectives include: detecting and protecting against online scams, fake profiles and deep-fakes, providing a browser-based extension for real-time analysis, giving each analysed item a “Trust Score”, ensuring users’ data privacy, enabling users to report suspicious content, and educating users about digital hygiene.

features.title: Key Features
list: Real-Time Browser Analysis: An extension integrates directly into the browser to provide immediate evaluations of suspicious pages or profiles.
Trust Score Calculation: Assigns a simple risk/reliability score to any analyzed web page, profile, or media, simplifying the user's decision-making process.
Advanced Detection: Core algorithms identify fake social profiles, fraudulent schemes, and manipulated media like deepfakes by analyzing content, metadata, and behavioral signals.
Secure Content Analysis: Users can safely upload URLs, images, and videos for assessment, with a strong focus on data privacy and protection.
Community Reporting Mechanism: Allows users to report suspicious content, contributing to a shared threat intelligence database that improves future detection for everyone.
Educational Resources: Provides downloadable guides, blog articles, and information about online safety to proactively educate users.
Enhanced User Experience: Features a multilingual interface and a theme toggle (light/dark mode) for broad accessibility and user comfort.

tech.title: Technical Approach
tech.description: TrustAI Shield combines a user-friendly interface with a powerful back-end analysis engine. It is built to be intuitive, requiring no technical training, and delivers results in under 10 seconds with 98% accuracy validated on over 10,000 real cases.

network-chatbot.title: AI-Powered Network Monitoring Chatbot
network-chatbot.subtitle: This solution focuses on improving the administrator experience in network monitoring through Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is an AIOps (AI for IT Operations) approach, transforming complex interactions with the existing monitoring system (Zabbix) into a simple, intuitive, and efficient dialogue via WhatsApp.

about.title: About the Project: Simplifying Network Operations
about.description: The proposed solution aims to significantly improve the network monitoring administrator experience through Artificial Intelligence (AI). It represents an AIOps (AI for IT Operations) approach, transforming the complex interaction with the existing supervision system (Zabbix) into a simple, intuitive, and effective dialogue via WhatsApp.

features.title: AI and Automation Features
list: Conversational WhatsApp Interface: Allows administrators to access monitoring information through an intuitive WhatsApp interface, providing real-time mobile access to network metrics.
Secure Authentication: Access to secure Zabbix commands is protected by chatbot authentication. The system temporarily blocks access after 3 incorrect password attempts.

Natural Language Analysis (`!zabbix analyze`): Provides a natural language summary of system performance, identifies priority issues, and offers recommendations using the Gemini API to interpret raw JSON data from Zabbix.
Failure Prevention (`!zabbix predict`): Estimates the risk of an incident for a host based on its metrics (RAM, CPU, ROM) using the Random Forest machine learning algorithm.
Automated Ticket Generation: The workflow automates the creation of support tickets via the GLPI API as soon as a technical incident is detected by Zabbix.

Enriched Notifications: Alerts received via WhatsApp are detailed and structured, including the GLPI ticket ID, a direct link, the host name, problem description, severity level, and a non-technical analysis with solution recommendations provided by the AI.

tech.title: Technical Implementation
tech.description: The solution is built on a multi-layered technology stack: Zabbix for technical monitoring, WhatsApp as the conversational entry point, n8n as the collection and automation engine, the Gemini language model for natural language interpretation, and GLPI for automated incident management. This transforms reactive monitoring into a proactive, intelligent supervision system, drastically reducing incident resolution times (MTTR).

secure-access-control.title: Robust Network Access Control System
secure-access-control.subtitle: A comprehensive security solution designed to protect corporate networks by implementing granular access control based on user identity and roles.

about.title: About the Project: Fortifying the First Line of Defense
about.description: In any corporate environment, controlling who can access the network is the first and most critical line of defense. This project involved engineering a robust and scalable access control system from the ground up, moving beyond simple password protection to a sophisticated, identity-based security model.

features.title: Key Features
list: AAA Framework: Utilizes the full Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) framework with Freeradius on a Linux server to manage network access.
802.1X Port-Based Authentication: Implements the IEEE 802.1X standard to ensure that only authenticated and authorized devices can connect to network ports (both wired and wireless).
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC): Assigns specific access rules and network segments (VLANs) to users based on their role within the organization, ensuring the principle of least privilege.
Comprehensive Access Logging: All access attempts—successful or failed—are logged, providing a clear and auditable trail for security analysis and compliance.

tech.title: Technical Implementation
tech.description: The system is centered around a Freeradius server running on a hardened Linux distribution. It integrates with existing network infrastructure, including Cisco switches and routers, to enforce access policies. The configuration allows for high scalability and can be adapted to support various authentication methods and directory services like LDAP or Active Directory.
